function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Social isolation and poor housing quality impact working performance and productivity during lockdown, potentially exacerbating mental health issues.","Impact":"Decreased productivity, worsened depressive symptoms, and reduced work-life balance.","Mitigation":"Improving housing conditions, promoting social connections, and providing resources for mental health support.","Technologies":"Remote working technologies, telecommuting infrastructure, and virtual communication tools.","People":"Workers, especially those in small apartments without designated workspaces.","Owner":"Employers, housing authorities, and mental health support organizations."},{"Description":"Lack of clear work-leisure boundaries and productivity-enhancing environment in small apartments may lead to decreased productivity and work-life imbalance.","Impact":"Decreased productivity and blurred work-leisure boundaries.","Mitigation":"Providing guidance on work-life balance, creating designated workspaces, and promoting time management strategies.","Technologies":"Productivity and time management apps, remote work tools, and ergonomic furniture for small spaces.","People":"Workers living in small apartments without designated workspaces.","Owner":"Employers, housing authorities, and productivity consultants."},{"Description":"Poor housing physical conditions may impact physical health and contribute to health inequalities during long-term stay-at-home periods.","Impact":"Physical health issues and exacerbated health inequalities.","Mitigation":"Upgrading housing physical conditions, implementing health-promoting policies, and increasing access to healthcare resources.","Technologies":"Smart home technology, home health monitoring devices, and telemedicine platforms.","People":"Individuals living in poor housing conditions and marginalized communities.","Owner":"Housing authorities, public health organizations, and policymakers."}]}
